alert.note: Alert for Haakon; Jackson; Mellette; Pennington (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 29 at 11:28PM MDT until July 30 at 12:30AM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: The National Weather Service in Rapid City has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Haakon County in west central South Dakota... West central Mellette County in south central South Dakota... Central Jackson County in southwestern South Dakota... East central Pennington County in west central South Dakota... * Until 1230 AM MDT/130 AM CDT/. * At 1128 PM MDT/1228 AM CDT/, a severe thunderstorm was located over Cottonwood, or 14 miles southwest of Philip, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Philip, Kadoka, Wanblee, Interior, Quinn, Cactus Flat, Cedar Pass, George Town, Cottonwood, Minuteman Missile Visitors Center, Delta 1 Launch Facility, Intersection of Highway 73 and White River, Snake Butte and northeastern Pine Ridge Reservation. This includes Interstate 90 in South Dakota between Mile Markers 119 and 157. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move immediately to shelter inside a strong building. Stay away from windows.
